posts.post_content:
This + [Last Laugh](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Last Laugh) + [Blessing of Leeches](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blessing of Leeches) and deal 1 point of damage to High Priest of Penance. It is a 3 card combo, (unless you count the 1 point damage dealing as a 4th, but run 4 of each in a 60 card deck with some tutors and board wipes just in case. Could be quite powerful.   
  
Best part that makes him a 5/5...."may"

posts.post_content:
[Darksteel Plate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Plate) is the obvious way to keep him destroying permanents. [Power of Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Power of Fire) and [Prodigal Pyromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prodigal Pyromancer) can deal damage on your terms at instent speed. [Spitemare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spitemare) is great on offense and defense. [Mudbutton Torchrunner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mudbutton Torchrunner) and [Goblin Arsonist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Arsonist) are your traps. To round it off, let's add some burn spells and a [Stuffy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy Doll).  
  
I want to call it "Flagellant Shrapnel" or "Stop Hitting Myself" or "Liar Liar."
posts.html:

I want to call it "Flagellant Shrapnel" or "Stop Hitting Myself" or "Liar Liar."

Posted By: phyrexiantrygon (2/3/2013 2:07:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I like this guy a lot. He has a "build around me" feel, but even more than that he's just stupid good without trying to break him. He is an excellent deterrent, capable of stalling the field because no one wants to mess with him and lose their best permanent. Even if a player kill spells him, they are essentially wasting a removal spell that could better be used on your beefy guys. I've even used him in multiplayer to kill my one of my opponent's biggest creatures by asking a third player to fry him with a burn spell.  
  
He can be used in absurd combos, perfectly reflects the stall and punish aspects of Orzhov, and can fill a variety of roles in multiplayer. The design team did an amazing job on Orzhov for this set.
posts.html:
I like this guy a lot. He has a "build around me" feel, but even more than that he's just stupid good without trying to break him. He is an excellent deterrent, capable of stalling the field because no one wants to mess with him and lose their best permanent. Even if a player kill spells him, they are essentially wasting a removal spell that could better be used on your beefy guys. I've even used him in multiplayer to kill my one of my opponent's biggest creatures by asking a third player to fry him with a burn spell.

He can be used in absurd combos, perfectly reflects the stall and punish aspects of Orzhov, and can fill a variety of roles in multiplayer. The design team did an amazing job on Orzhov for this set.
